title: I really like how Jhin is designed.
body:
(this post is not about balance, but kit design much like my fiora one)
He's the epitome of a sniper. High amounts of damage on the bullets/abilities but fairly long cooldowns, much like a snpier in real life has to reload before shooting again. 
His abilities are all fairly unique. His passive is essentially trigonometry, his Q is a point and click that still takes skill to land if you want max damage, his W is a great utility and sniping tool, his E is a unique trap (unlike other ones {{champion:17}} {{champion:51}} it allows you to walk out of it), and his ult is simply amazing. 
His ult allows for a lot more counterplay than people give it, you can dodge, block, and walk out of the range of the bullets. It leaves him vulnerable while he his ulting so good positioning is rewarded.

Don't even get me started on his VO and visual effects. Killing someone with him just looks beautiful(as it should).

Good on you rito, you made a well designed champion.
Now im just waiting for duskblade to be meelee only ;-;

I like Duskblade on a Marksman sometimes myself, but it seems that it is still better on an Assassin. You will weaken your champion's effectiveness against groups of enemies by buying Duskblade, so I personally think it's fair. Sure, if he hits minions 3 times and then a champion a 4th then the Duskblade really packs a wallop, but as players have mentioned in other comments, that will leave him vulnerable while he's reloading.

I actually haven't managed to finish buying a Runaan's Hurricane as Jhin yet. Everytime I try we have won the game or lost it before I could get to that point, but I'm curious as to how good it is on him. Some people may not like getting attack speed on him, but since it can translate into movement speed I think it's fine. I still have to do the math though on raw movement speed versus attack speed that converts into movement speed.

Runaan's is good for waveclear, but Statikk Shiv does pretty much the same thing, and come mid/late game, the Shiv proc + his Q + autos is enough to decimate waves. Runaan's is pretty much useless otherwise, while Shiv proc damage on champs is still good.

Well I haven't played enough games with him to know if Shiv would be useful on him but so far I haven't had a problem with tanks(but it's pretty rare to see tanks if you're not even playing ranked I guess...mostly people just play assassins) with him. Having a magic damage option in the form of Shiv would be nice, but I might be tempted to build even more attack speed and movement speed in addition to it if I'm really scared of some high armor enemy like a Rammus or a Malphite or whatever...since I don't know what else I can do to kill them so I might as well do a little poke and keep on moving you know?
I mean I was telling you that Shiv is better than Runaan's as someone who plays Jhin extremely often.
I don't see how it's better since they do different things. One does magic damage the other does physical damage.

Because Runaan's is better on someone who can continuously attack full-speed nonstop to continuously keep shooting the additional two bolts.
Jhin has four shots and then a break of 2.5 seconds he can't do anything about.
He might as well run up and shoot a wave and nearly instantly kill it with said Shiv proc from running/poke someone with said Shiv proc.

It might depend more on your keystone and runes. If you have hybrid penetration runes, then it would make sense to take Thunderlord's Decree I suppose because you could also take Precision for even more penetration in magic damage. Then you get Shiv because you can make a lot more punch with it with all that magic penetration.

I don't use that setup myself but I might if I had to play him in top or mid lane. So far nobody has asked me to and right now I tend to have a lot more fun playing Tanks in those positions. Do you buy AP sometimes? Don't his traps scale with AP like Jinx's? Just wondering. A Hextech Gunblade might be a legit item on him I suppose. Getting a small amount of life back for your Shiv damage would be nice.

Also I don't consider Jhin to be taking a break while he's reloading...he can still use Q and W while that's going on. He also kind of needs to be running around with that movement speed boost.

But Jhin has like almost no magical damage to the extent of memory.
Shiv proc by itself is still strong.
His traps scale with AD and AP both and do magic damage, but actually getting traps on people for damage is inconsistent.

I thought if you buy magic damage you'd want to make sure it's worth it instead of just encouraging opponents to build MR against you and it multiplies as protection against your allies that are primarily magic damagers. 

If you had for example a Zed on your team...he does zero magic damage, isn't that right? So maybe it makes more sense to build yourself as a Hybrid Damager so that the opponents don't amass armor to neutralize you both at the same time.

So you can discourage your opponents from building armor or you'll punish them for countering the Zed as with a lot of Magic Damage you may still be a threat. Well, that's the idea but I guess you could always just pick an arguably more appropriate champion for that.
Yeah but I mean buying AP on him is worthless.
